intro: Asarca inconspicua, commonly known as the small green orchid, is a delicate flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or yellow-green in color. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands, often on the forest floor or along stream banks. It has a slender, wiry stem with a few leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Asarca inconspicua is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions to thrive.
